column5: They are hoping for Wed.   I'm sure this public notice is not well received, by many.  Next thing you know they will be asking central Ontarians to play Host to Toronto refugees.     Please share your generators, wood supply and wood stoves.  Take a family in need in for the week.....  Entropy
Thanks Cliff...Here is the latest:

If you are going to be without power and the temperatures in the house could reach freezing don't forget to winterize your house. Turn off the main water and open all of the faucets both hot and cold. If you have a drain valve or bleed on the main water valve open that also. Turn off the breaker to the water heater you can drain the heater if you want it is not likely to freeze over a day or two.. Flush the toilets and then add antifreeze to the tank and the bowls as well as the traps in the sinks. Finally dump a little in the dishwasher and the washer machine. This should try to keep you from having frozen pipes and slit pipes. If you have a question feel free to P.M. me I will answer them as quickly as I can.   Art
good point ART
Darn the luck Beans, well, best we can do is hope for a full recovery. Do you need transportation to the hospital to see her? I could take you tomorrow if you need.
Anyone know if the power is on in Newmarket?? I still gotta do my Christmas shopping and I generally do it at the Upper Canada Mall....
haha leaving it to the last minute eh!
I've been kicked out of the best of malls on Christmas Eve.. MANY times ! lol
Looks like cell towers are out... no reply from brother in Orangeville or Niece in Etobicoke.
Try ham radio.

Darn the luck Beans, well, best we can do is hope for a full recovery. Do you need transportation to the hospital to see her? I could take you tomorrow if you need.  Thanks for the offer Cliff but she is down in Scarboro and doesn't want people to drive there right now...in her words...  " If you drive and get in an accident and end up worse than me and make them postpone my operation, I will find you and suffocate you with a pillow!...LOL "  Yep...she is her late mother's daughter...

Active Outages: 485 Affected Customers: 99216  Most are along the Lake Ontario shores down as far as Brockville. Not much around your place Lew....closest is probably Roseneath with 20 or so powerless households. Hydro One reports are upgraded every 15 minutes. Most existing outages are scheduled to be restored later this morning. A very few of them won't be restored before tomorrow.
You two sound like a mortician trying to drum up business. lol  I just want to be able to justify spending all that money Art

That is only hydro one customers Roy. There are a lot of areas ie Toronto, Milton, etc that are not shown on the hydro one site.  Parts of Lindsay were/are without power and that is just within the last hour. As of 5:30 this morning the weather network was showing 135,000 without power at that point, hydro one only listed about 50,000. We are getting heavy freezing rain here right now, I have a feeling the worst is yet to come.
Let's just hope that it's not a replay of our '98 adventure.
Sorry to hear about your granddaughter Norm  We still have no power and most of the trees are down or have lost most of their branches.   Got the Coleman making coffee right now.

I just want to be able to justify spending all that money Art  I put an automatic unit in about 10 years ago and every time it runs I am sooooooo thankful I have it.  My wife thought I was an idiot when I installed it but now she is all for it as well.  It doesn't run everything in the house but all the critical stuff is running (sump pumps, water pump, water heater, a few lights and outlets, beer fridge in the garage, fish freezer,  big screen, etc).  Be patient, someday you will be thankful too.  The ice in Norfolk county is building rapidly and it's still coming down quite hard here.  Gonna be a big mess if it keeps up much longer.  Everybody stay safe, we don't need any more broken legs before Christmas.
Just lost our power here in Orangeville.
Be patient, someday you will be thankful too.   Yeah I know, but it sure is a nice feeling knowing it'll automatically fire up whenever the power goes out.

I lost power for three hours this morning (6-9) just easy of London and my generator wouldn't start. I have been sick and unable to test it out and repair the last while. Thankfully, my neighbour was able to borrow a generator and I could also plug my sump pump into it. Once I was in the clear, the power came back on.  I have a few branches down on the property but no real damage.  I better get that generator going and back to monthly starts.

Our power hasnt even flickered here yet, but im expecting it to at any time. Id say we have close to an inch of ice on everything here. My mature maples are still holding up, but im getting concerned. Its only getting worse right now. We're all good though. Lots of food, water, fuel and firewood.  S.
Got a hose you can hook to the hot water tap at the washing machine Shayne and spray the limb ends and melt some ice off?
Its not that bad yet wayne. We'll be fine. I kinda like the adventure of it. My trees are on good shape, its gonna take a lot more ice than this to knock them over....i think!
Our power went out from about 10 am to noon today. Lots of limbs down around town but ice is melting off the trees now.

When mine fall I just look at it as good hardwood that's already horizontal and ready to cut up and split! Saves me getting hit by dead heads when the tree falls the conventional way in the forest!  We've still got power up here... but the almost invisible rain is really starting to be visible on the trees so who knows for how long. Oh well.. like I said in another thread... I go to bed at night and I get up in the morning.. but of course I can do that because I have a generator, three fireplaces in the house, a wood stove in the workshop, two tractors (one with a bucket and hoe), two chainsaws and a hydraulic splitter... oh and 500 gallons of AV gas and 300 gallons (700 if I include the furnace tanks) of diesel on site.

"Norm, did your grandaughter get her surgery yesterday? It looks like a nasty break. Hope it all goes well for her."  Thanks Roy...and no surgery yet...I have a feeling they are waiting for a specialist...I am keeping Facebook open in case there is any news...She seems to be in good spirits...this is what she posted this morning...
If any of mine come down, they are the ones I planned on taking down anyways. The rest are good healthy trees....shouldnt be a problem!  S.
You got a hoe. Lucky you.
Two of them actually... one foreign.. one domestic!
Dang,you got the best of both worlds.
Two of them actually... one foreign.. one domestic! You know Arnold Schwarzenegger?
That's not a problem Lew, good pair of wire cutters and I could put ya in test mode
That's not a problem Lew, good pair of wire cutters and I could put ya in test mode Yes, and if the power is still on when he goes to work with those wire cutters, you'll even get a light show

Two things; Norm, I just asked a favor from the big guy, keep us posted.  Just spent 2 1/2 hours out there with the snow blower and shovel, as I put the snow blower away the freezing rain started again. I have a feeling we aren't out of the woods yet with regard to power outages.
Already has a built in test mode Phil and she automatically  fires up every Monday morning at 9:30 am sharp and runs for 15 minutes.  Much safer than wire cutters

Toronto Hydro crews assessing damage and responding to emergency calls, asking customers to 'share the power'    TORONTO, Dec. 22, 2013 /CNW/ - Toronto Hydro-Electric System (Toronto Hydro) is reporting that over 250,000 customers are without power across the city as a result of the ice storm.  Areas with overhead power lines are the hardest hit: Etobicoke, North York and Scarborough. Toronto Hydro is concerned that wind gusts and further adverse weather will hamper the restoration efforts.   As a result of the volume of calls that continue to come in, and the current weather conditions, Toronto Hydro is asking customers to prepare for the worst-case scenario. While the utility hopes to have everyone restored by Wednesday, it is asking customers to make alternate arrangements, if possible.   There are a number of customers who may have special needs or are elderly; Toronto Hydro asks that residents check on their neighbours.   For customers with electricity service, Toronto Hydro is asking that they "share the power" and consider inviting neighbours inside.   The City of Toronto has also opened a number of warming stations, they can be found at www.toronto.ca   Toronto Hydro crews are working to on public safety calls first, then on to restore priority customers such as hospitals, city services and TTC.  All available resources have been deployed and crews are working as quickly as possible to restore power.

I don't know if your area does this but here in Oshawa I get all the FREE salted sand that I want,at the city maintenance yard.People were lined up 10 deep filling their buckets..  vance  Sounds like a great deal, I get mine  from a private company but it's only $7 for a 60 pound bag so it's not too bad.
Just rain in the Falls so far. I stocked up on dollar store heat packs for my scale babies and  topped up the BBQ tank.
Genny's ready to go,lots of food and gas!!Because you never know ?Hope it's no where near what they say it could be.
Hope it's no where near what they say it could be.  Sposed to get freezing rain here all day but so far nothing since early morning....hope the luck holds.
Wanted to get some Jack Daniels Winter Jack, but the LCBO was sold out.  I will not be fully ready.

If you are lucky the warm front we have here will push up North far enough to give you some relief. Today is short sleeves and 68F and Sunday record breaking 72F.  I hate Ice storms they are the one thing that really wreaks havoc  down here.   Good luck Y'all   Art

Made it to the airport by 10:30 yesterday. Flight out was on time and we were at our NYC hotel by 3pm. It's 12 degrees C. Now if I could get someone to shovel the drive before we get home...  On it Rob,wheres the spare key?    OH WAIT  You said shovel. Im a snow blower kinda guy.LOL
Looking at the Hydro One site there are some sporadic power outages, but nothing too severe yet.Hope that it continues that way.  http://www.hydroone.com/stormcenter3/
I'm in Fonthill (Niagara), 2:30 am - pouring rain, ice forming on the trees, truck & van.  Doesn't look good!  Have internet Woo Hoo!

Well I was trying to sleep but all I can hear is tree branches cracking off, and splitting, then hitting the ground.  We just lost power.  We're getting pummeled here.  It better let up soon or the neighbors willow tree is going down, it's hanging over so bad right now.  Wonder how long my laptop battery lasts

Walking can get tricky along with driving...  My grandaughter slipped on some ice at work (day-care) yesterday morning and did a real number on her leg (3 breaks) and ankle (dislocated)  Andrea's X-ray.jpg  They should be operating on her this morning...  I pray she doesn't end up with a permanent limp...   Really sorry about your daughter. That looks terribly painful.
I have lost around 50% of the crown on a lot of trees, one 6"limb on the roof and more to come with this wind. Not as bad as Norm's granddaughter, but painful to me. I love my trees.
It's quite icy here but powers still on. Ice not heavy enough yet to cause branches or power lines to come down. Just seen on an other forum power is out in the Niagara area.

Sorry to hear about your grandaughter Norm. hope she gets well taken care of really quickly.  Thanks for posting that link Bernie, just had a good look at it, they are now reporting about 135,000 customers without power and expect more to come.  5:00 am and all is well here so far, we were/are all prepaired just in case though. I thought we might loose our internet because we are on wireless but it is still hanging in there.  Keep safe everyone.

Norm, did your grandaughter get her surgery yesterday? It looks like a nasty break. Hope it all goes well for her.  Here the weather is not good. Heavy snow everywhere. Right now it sounds like the hail will be coming through the skylights at any minute. The lights have dimmed a few times in the last couple of hours. Just J and I here and we don't have to go anywhere. All emergency stuff is ready for use. Jenny and big Bertha are both ready to be fired up. Lots of firewood inside. Expecting 15-30cm more snow today with 20-30mm rain for later this evening. We were going to do a lazy day with ribs in the slow cooker but I don't think the crock pot will be a good option for today. Everyone stay safe and if you don't have to travel today,,,DON'T!

Lotsa freezing rain late yesterday and  it looks like we got about 5" of ice pellets overnight and now were back into freezing rain just to add to the fun, but the power is still on.  Sposed to be decent tomorrow so I think I'll just wait till then before starting the cleanup.

We are lucky here its all rain and lots of it as my sump pump has been going on every 1/2 hour since 2am or so. Its not good for the early ice we have as I can imagine its going to get blown out from the creeks and rivers but its better then having the trees falling covered in ice.  Stay safe to everyone east of Chatham that is getting freezing rain
Heavy snowfall warning up here. Looks like I'll be spending my time today plowing.
We just lost power here about 10 minutes ago but it came back on withing about 2 minutes. Hope it stays that way!
Just tried to get into the hydro one storm center site, seems it is down. I'm thinking there must be a lot more people without power by now.

We lost power from about 2am to 6:30am, so far not to bad.  Hopefully it stays on!  My neighbours tree is halfway down across his driveway, and several neighbours have trees with limbs down.  I am fortunate and have no trees over my house, they are all at the back of the lot.  They are calling for more in our area, and if that happens we are going to have a lot more downed tree limbs!

I'm thinking there must be a lot more people without power by now.  I'm sitting here with a very $$$$ permanent generator and we haven't lost power yet. Darned near wish the power would go out for awhile so I could say it was worth the money to have it installed.

Lost power around 2 and came back on around 6am. Lots of ice and downed tree limbs. Just got internet back up. Lotsa scotch, beer, wine and food... and plenty of propane to cook if power goes out again...Supposedly tens of thousands without power in southern ontario for some time to come..

I'm sitting here with a very $$$$ permanent generator and we haven't lost power yet. Darned near wish the power would go out for awhile so I could say it was worth the money to have it installed. LOL, I bought mine about 5 years ago when we went without power for 5 days. Haven't had to use it yet.  Finally got into the Hydro One site and the number of people without power is climbing rapidly, there is still time Lew

You two sound like a mortician trying to drum up business. lol The reports we are not getting are from the ones who are down already with no mobile internet capacity. Hopefully everyone will ride out the storm with the least amount of damage.   Art

Just channel hopping and on the weather network there is a freezing rain warning for a lot of southern Ontario.Looks like there is a good chance of a fair amount of freezing rain that could bring down power lines.Hope you all fare out well through it.Best be prepared.
what time does the beer store close?
Lets hope it,smacks the snow down on the ice too.  Chris  Stocked till  2nd of January.
I have everything I need at home but my son,dlaw and grandson are flying into pearson at midnite and I am concerned about their trip to oshawa !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  vance
I'd rather snow. But the ice fisherman in me says, good melt the snow.
Lucky for me we get to drive to NB tomorrow
Generator is full Fridge is stocked Freezer is stocked Enough fuel for 5-6 days I'm ready Bring it My guess is that it stays rain with little to no freezing
My guess is that it stays rain with little to no freezing  I hope you're right. I'm heading for London this weekend and not liking the current forecast.
It been freezing rain here in Orangeville all day pretty good coating on everything...drive and walk careful.
Still nothing but rain down in Niagara
In the SW corner it looks ok for us lots of rain but the temps are staying up. I hope everyone has a safe holiday weekend and stays safe.
No freezing rain here. Just freezing temps!!! A balmy -36 right now with -45 wind chill.  I'll take this over an ice storm thank you very much.

Thanx for the heads up Bernie.  I've been watching the weather forecasts  for 2 days.  Here in Niagara - lottsa rain, mild temps but no freezing rain yet.  Fridge is full, lottsa bottled water, 2 propane heaters, BBQ, candles & firewood are ready!!  Coleman stove & lantern are close by as well.
Hope the weather clears up. I have to land in that big airport in about 9 hours.

Snowed here all day yesterday and now the freezing rain is coming down on top of it. Looks like I'm in the center of the freezing rain warning for the next 2 days so it could get interesting.  Oh  well, they topped up my 1500 litre propane tank yesterday so if the power goes out for an extended period, my generator should be good for a long time.  Hope everyone stays safe.
Lets hope it,smacks the snow down on the ice too.  Chris  Stocked till  2nd of January. X10 Bro
I woke up at 5am to normal rain. The drive down to the US border was straight rain too.
Lucky for me we get to drive to NB tomorrow Christopher, don't till me you're a coaster?
My dad's been "preppin" for years now..  If the power goes out and all hell breaks loose, I think I'll go crash at his pad..  safe travels everyone.
Living on a corner house is hard on your salt dollars. Went thru 2 10kg bags this morning.
I know your pain, I have tenants and a 70 foot driveway that gets icy in a hurry
Made it to the airport by 10:30 yesterday. Flight out was on time and we were at our NYC hotel by 3pm. It's 12 degrees C. Now if I could get someone to shovel the drive before we get home...

Walking can get tricky along with driving...  My grandaughter slipped on some ice at work (day-care) yesterday morning and did a real number on her leg (3 breaks) and ankle (dislocated)    They should be operating on her this morning...  I pray she doesn't end up with a permanent limp...
That's real tough luck for your Grandaughter Norm, sure hope everything works out OK for her.

Living on a corner house is hard on your salt dollars. Went thru 2 10kg bags this morning. I don't know if your area does this but here in Oshawa I get all the FREE salted sand that I want,at the city maintenance yard.People were lined up 10 deep filling their buckets..  vance
